trans-unit.source: Querying DocumentDB Resources
trans-unit.target: Querying DocumentDB Resources

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to use REST to query DocumentDB resources.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to use REST to query DocumentDB resources.

trans-unit.source: What resources can be queried by using REST?
trans-unit.target: What resources can be queried by using REST?

trans-unit.source: All DocumentDB resources except account resources can be queried using DocumentDB SQL language.
trans-unit.target: All DocumentDB resources except account resources can be queried using DocumentDB SQL language.

trans-unit.source: For more information on DocumentDB SQL Language, see <externalLink><linkText>Query with DocumentDB SQL</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-sql-query</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on DocumentDB SQL Language, see <externalLink><linkText>Query with DocumentDB SQL</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-sql-query</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: How do I query a resource by using REST?
trans-unit.target: How do I query a resource by using REST?

trans-unit.source: To perform a SQL query on a resource, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To perform a SQL query on a resource, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Execute a POST method against a resource path using JSON with the "query" property set to the SQL query string, and the "parameters" property set to the array of optional parameter values.
trans-unit.target: Execute a POST method against a resource path using JSON with the "query" property set to the SQL query string, and the "parameters" property set to the array of optional parameter values.

trans-unit.source: Set the x-ms-documentdb-isquery header to true.
trans-unit.target: Set the x-ms-documentdb-isquery header to true.

trans-unit.source: Set the Content-Type header to application/query+json.
trans-unit.target: Set the Content-Type header to application/query+json.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: Below is an example REST query operation on document resources.
trans-unit.target: Below is an example REST query operation on document resources.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we would like to find all documents that have "Don" as an author.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we would like to find all documents that have "Don" as an author.

trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.target: The authentication type and signature token.

trans-unit.source: Only the master key token is allowed for this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the master key token is allowed for this operation.

trans-unit.target: Standard Header

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: At the moment, DocumentDB always returns the response payload in standard JSON format.
trans-unit.target: At the moment, DocumentDB always returns the response payload in standard JSON format.

trans-unit.source: The client must be able to accept the response body in standard JSON format.

trans-unit.source: User-Agent
trans-unit.target: User-Agent

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The user agent performing the request.
trans-unit.target: The user agent performing the request.

trans-unit.source: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.
trans-unit.target: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.

trans-unit.source: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the User-Agent string to Microsoft.Document.Client/1.0.0.0.
trans-unit.target: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the User-Agent string to Microsoft.Document.Client/1.0.0.0.

trans-unit.source: Custom Header
trans-unit.target: Custom Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: x-ms-date
trans-unit.target: x-ms-date

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The date of the request, as specified in RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date of the request, as specified in RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: The date format is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example.
trans-unit.target: The date format is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-documentdb-isquery
trans-unit.target: x-ms-documentdb-isquery

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This property must be set to true.
trans-unit.target: This property must be set to true.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-max-item-count
trans-unit.target: x-ms-max-item-count

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: To page through a result set, set this header to the maximum number for items to be returned back in a single page.
trans-unit.target: To page through a result set, set this header to the maximum number for items to be returned back in a single page.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-continuation
trans-unit.target: x-ms-continuation

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: To navigate to the next page of items, set this header to the continuation token for the next page.
trans-unit.target: To navigate to the next page of items, set this header to the continuation token for the next page.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-version
trans-unit.target: x-ms-version

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The version of DocumentDB REST service.
trans-unit.target: The version of DocumentDB REST service.

trans-unit.source: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.
trans-unit.target: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DocumentDB REST API</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DocumentDB REST API</link>.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-documentdb-query-enable-scan
trans-unit.target: x-ms-documentdb-query-enable-scan

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Use an index scan to process the query if the right index path of type is not available.
trans-unit.target: Use an index scan to process the query if the right index path of type is not available.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-session-token
trans-unit.target: x-ms-session-token

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The session token for the request.
trans-unit.target: The session token for the request.

trans-unit.source: Used for session consistency.
trans-unit.target: Used for session consistency.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The request body should be a valid JSON document containing the SQL query and parameters.
trans-unit.target: The request body should be a valid JSON document containing the SQL query and parameters.

trans-unit.source: If the input is malformed or invalid SQL syntax, the operation with fails with a 400 Bad Request error.
trans-unit.target: If the input is malformed or invalid SQL syntax, the operation with fails with a 400 Bad Request error.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: query
trans-unit.target: query

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query string for the query.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query string for the query.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link xlink:href="044988d8-09ea-45c9-bee8-611f778fde02" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DocumentDB SQL Query Language</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link xlink:href="044988d8-09ea-45c9-bee8-611f778fde02" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DocumentDB SQL Query Language</link>.

trans-unit.source: parameters
trans-unit.target: parameters

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: A JSON array of parameters specified as name value pairs.
trans-unit.target: A JSON array of parameters specified as name value pairs.

trans-unit.source: The parameter array can contain from zero to many parameters.Each parameter must have the following values:<legacyBold>name</legacyBold>: the name of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: The parameter array can contain from zero to many parameters.Each parameter must have the following values:<legacyBold>name</legacyBold>: the name of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: Parameter names must be valid string literals and begin with ‘@’.<legacyBold>value</legacyBold>: the value of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Parameter names must be valid string literals and begin with ‘@’.<legacyBold>value</legacyBold>: the value of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: Can be any valid JSON value (string, number, object, array, Boolean or null).
trans-unit.target: Can be any valid JSON value (string, number, object, array, Boolean or null).

trans-unit.target: Request Example

trans-unit.source: The following example makes a parameterized SQL request with a string parameter for @author.
trans-unit.target: The following example makes a parameterized SQL request with a string parameter for @author.

trans-unit.source: Response Details
trans-unit.target: Response Details

trans-unit.source: The following are common status codes returned by this operation.
trans-unit.target: The following are common status codes returned by this operation.

trans-unit.source: For information about error status codes, please see <link xlink:href="7104e4ef-fa51-4194-93f0-bb5f53fe9d61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HTTP Status Codes for DocumentDB</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about error status codes, please see <link xlink:href="7104e4ef-fa51-4194-93f0-bb5f53fe9d61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HTTP Status Codes for DocumentDB</link>.

trans-unit.source: Code
trans-unit.target: Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: 200 Ok
trans-unit.target: 200 Ok

trans-unit.source: The operation is successful.
trans-unit.target: The operation is successful.

trans-unit.source: 400 Bad Request
trans-unit.target: 400 Bad Request

trans-unit.source: The syntax of the SQL statement is incorrect.
trans-unit.target: The syntax of the SQL statement is incorrect.

trans-unit.source: 401 Unauthorized
trans-unit.target: 401 Unauthorized

trans-unit.source: Either the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.
trans-unit.target: Either the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.

trans-unit.source: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.
trans-unit.target: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 403 Forbidden

trans-unit.source: The authorization token has expired.
trans-unit.target: The authorization token has expired.

trans-unit.source: 404 Not Found
trans-unit.target: 404 Not Found

trans-unit.source: The collection is no longer a resource.
trans-unit.target: The collection is no longer a resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, the resource may have been deleted.
trans-unit.target: For example, the resource may have been deleted.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: This operation returns the following common headers.
trans-unit.target: This operation returns the following common headers.

trans-unit.source: There may be additional standard and common headers returned.
trans-unit.target: There may be additional standard and common headers returned.

trans-unit.source: Standard Header
trans-unit.target: Standard Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Content-Type
trans-unit.target: Content-Type

trans-unit.source: The Content-Type is application/json.
trans-unit.target: The Content-Type is application/json.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB always return the response body in standard JSON format.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB always return the response body in standard JSON format.

trans-unit.source: Date
trans-unit.target: Date

trans-unit.source: The date-time of the response operation.
trans-unit.target: The date-time of the response operation.

trans-unit.source: This date time format conforms to the [RFC1123] date time format expressed in UTC.
trans-unit.target: This date time format conforms to the [RFC1123] date time format expressed in UTC.

trans-unit.source: Custom Header
trans-unit.target: Custom Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: x-ms-item-count
trans-unit.target: x-ms-item-count

trans-unit.source: The number of item returned by the operation.
trans-unit.target: The number of item returned by the operation.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-continuation
trans-unit.target: x-ms-continuation

trans-unit.source: This is an opaque string returned when the query has potentially more items to be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: This is an opaque string returned when the query has potentially more items to be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: The x-ms-continuation can be included in subsequent requests as a request header to resume execution of the query.
trans-unit.target: The x-ms-continuation can be included in subsequent requests as a request header to resume execution of the query.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-request-charge
trans-unit.target: x-ms-request-charge

trans-unit.source: This is the number of request units (RU) consumed by the operation.
trans-unit.target: This is the number of request units (RU) consumed by the operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about request units, see <externalLink><linkText>Managing DocumentDB Capacity and Performance</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-manage</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about request units, see <externalLink><linkText>Managing DocumentDB Capacity and Performance</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-manage</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-activity-id
trans-unit.target: x-ms-activity-id

trans-unit.source: This is a unique identifier for the operation.
trans-unit.target: This is a unique identifier for the operation.

trans-unit.source: It can be used for tracing execution of DocumentDB requests.
trans-unit.target: It can be used for tracing execution of DocumentDB requests.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-session-token
trans-unit.target: x-ms-session-token

trans-unit.source: The session token to be used for subsequent requests.
trans-unit.target: The session token to be used for subsequent requests.

trans-unit.source: Used for session consistency.
trans-unit.target: Used for session consistency.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The response body for the query operation consists of the _rid of the parent resource of the resource being queried, and the resource array containing the resource properties for the projection and selection.
trans-unit.target: The response body for the query operation consists of the _rid of the parent resource of the resource being queried, and the resource array containing the resource properties for the projection and selection.

trans-unit.source: As per the example, if a query was performed on the <legacyBold>docs</legacyBold> path of the collection with an _rid of XP0mAJ3H-AA=, the response would be as follows:
trans-unit.target: As per the example, if a query was performed on the <legacyBold>docs</legacyBold> path of the collection with an _rid of XP0mAJ3H-AA=, the response would be as follows:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: The resource id for the collection used within the query.
trans-unit.target: The resource id for the collection used within the query.

trans-unit.source: _count
trans-unit.target: _count

trans-unit.source: The number of items returned.
trans-unit.target: The number of items returned.

trans-unit.source: Resource array
trans-unit.target: Resource array

trans-unit.source: The array containing the query results.
trans-unit.target: The array containing the query results.

trans-unit.source: Building the query request body
trans-unit.target: Building the query request body

trans-unit.source: The query request must be a valid JSON document containing a <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> property that contains a valid SQL query string and a <legacyBold>parameters</legacyBold> property that contains an array of optional parameters.
trans-unit.target: The query request must be a valid JSON document containing a <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> property that contains a valid SQL query string and a <legacyBold>parameters</legacyBold> property that contains an array of optional parameters.

trans-unit.source: Each parameter should have a <legacyBold>name</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>value</legacyBold> property of parameters that are specified within the query.
trans-unit.target: Each parameter should have a <legacyBold>name</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>value</legacyBold> property of parameters that are specified within the query.

trans-unit.source: Parameter names must begin with the “@” character.
trans-unit.target: Parameter names must begin with the “@” character.

trans-unit.source: Values can be any valid JSON values – strings, integers, Booleans and nulls.
trans-unit.target: Values can be any valid JSON values – strings, integers, Booleans and nulls.

trans-unit.source: It is valid to specifiy only a subset of parameters specified in the <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> text.
trans-unit.target: It is valid to specifiy only a subset of parameters specified in the <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> text.

trans-unit.source: Expressions that reference these unspecified parameters will evaluate to <legacyBold>undefined</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Expressions that reference these unspecified parameters will evaluate to <legacyBold>undefined</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: It is also valid to specify additional parameters that are not used within the <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> text.
trans-unit.target: It is also valid to specify additional parameters that are not used within the <legacyBold>query</legacyBold> text.

trans-unit.source: Some examples of valid query requests are shown below.
trans-unit.target: Some examples of valid query requests are shown below.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following query has a single parameter @id.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following query has a single parameter @id.

trans-unit.source: The following example has two parameters, one with a string value and another with an integer value.
trans-unit.target: The following example has two parameters, one with a string value and another with an integer value.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses parameters within the SELECT clause, as well as a property accessed through the parameter name as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: The following example uses parameters within the SELECT clause, as well as a property accessed through the parameter name as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: Pagination of query results
trans-unit.target: Pagination of query results

trans-unit.source: Query requests support pagination through the <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation request</legacyBold> headers.
trans-unit.target: Query requests support pagination through the <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation request</legacyBold> headers.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> header specifies the maximum number of values that can be returned by the query execution.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> header specifies the maximum number of values that can be returned by the query execution.

trans-unit.source: This can be between 1 and 1000, and is configured with a default of 100.
trans-unit.target: This can be between 1 and 1000, and is configured with a default of 100.

trans-unit.source: Queries will return from zero up to the maximum specified <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> values from the results of the execution.
trans-unit.target: Queries will return from zero up to the maximum specified <legacyBold>x-ms-max-item-count</legacyBold> values from the results of the execution.

trans-unit.source: The query result includes an <legacyBold>x-ms-item-count</legacyBold> header that specifies the actual number of documents returned by the query.
trans-unit.target: The query result includes an <legacyBold>x-ms-item-count</legacyBold> header that specifies the actual number of documents returned by the query.

trans-unit.source: If there are additional results that could be retrieved from the query, then the response includes a non-empty value for the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header.
trans-unit.target: If there are additional results that could be retrieved from the query, then the response includes a non-empty value for the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header.

trans-unit.source: Clients can fetch subsequent pages of results by echoing the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header as another request.
trans-unit.target: Clients can fetch subsequent pages of results by echoing the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header as another request.

trans-unit.source: In order to read all results, clients must repeat this process until an empty <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> is returned.
trans-unit.target: In order to read all results, clients must repeat this process until an empty <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> is returned.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB query executions are stateless at the server side, and can be resumed at any time using the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB query executions are stateless at the server side, and can be resumed at any time using the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> value uses the last processed document resource ID (_rid) to track progress of execution.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> value uses the last processed document resource ID (_rid) to track progress of execution.

trans-unit.source: Therefore if documents are deleted and re-inserted between fetching of pages, then it could potentially be excluded from any of the query batches.
trans-unit.target: Therefore if documents are deleted and re-inserted between fetching of pages, then it could potentially be excluded from any of the query batches.

trans-unit.source: However, the behavior and format of the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header might change in a future service update.
trans-unit.target: However, the behavior and format of the <legacyBold>x-ms-continuation</legacyBold> header might change in a future service update.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB documentation
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB documentation
